title: Today’s entertainment picks:
text:
Published: Sun, October 11, 2015 @ 12:00 a.m. 
Today’s entertainment picks: 
v Oktoberfest, 9 a.m. to 7 p.m.: A Bavarian bash, featuring music by the Saxon Band and Austi (free admission) at Kravitz Deli, Colonial Plaza, 3135 Belmont Ave., Liberty; oktoberfestyoungstown.org. 
v Old Fashioned Christmas in the Woods, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.: The finest artisans and craftsmen, in period dress, sell and demonstrate their products in a wooded village ($8) at the Shaker Woods grounds, 44337 County Line Road, just off state Route 7, one mile north of state Route 14, near Columbiana; christmasohio.com. 
v “The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee,” 2 p.m.: The warm, quirky and hilarious musical at Youngstown State University Theater’s Ford Theater, inside Bliss Hall; 330-941-3105. 
v “The Colored Museum,” 2 p.m.: Insightful deconstruction of race in the Moyer Room at Youngstown Playhouse,off Glenwood Avenue; 330-788-8739 
v “Just Jingle,” 2 p.m.: Last chance to catch the premiere run of this original lighthearted jukebox musical, presented by Stage Left Players, at Trinity Playhouse, 234 E. Lincoln Way, Lisbon; 330-831-7249. 
“Madam Secretary” (8 p.m., CBS): Elizabeth (Tea Leoni) gets some advice from former Secretary of State Madeleine Albright, who guest stars as herself on “Madam Secretary.” She needs her help while trying to negotiate the safe return of a State Department employee who was kidnapped in Afghanistan. 
“Brooklyn Nine-Nine” (8:30 P.M., FOX): Mary Lynn Rajskub (“24”) is the latest familiar face to drop in on “Brooklyn Nine-Nine.” She plays a gallery owner and Jake (Andy Samberg) thinks she just might be Boyle’s (Joe Lo Truglio) soul mate, so he tries to set them up. 
“The Walking Dead” (9 p.m., AMC): So much for the Alexandria “Safe Zone” being an oasis of tranquility amid the zombie apocalypse. That all fell apart during last season’s traumatic finale when Rick (Andrew Lincoln) killed Pete in the middle of a town meeting that went horribly awry. Now, as Season 6 gets underway, Rick has a lot of wary eyes looking his way. 
TV Listings, b8 
Arts academy ready to open 
YOUNGSTOWN 
The Southside Fine Arts Academy, located at the Fairview Arts and Outreach Center, 4220 Youngstown-Poland Road, will open Tuesday at 4 p.m., sponsored by Mahoning Valley Chorale. Parents of children in grades K through 12 interested in taking classes there are welcome. Classes are on Tuesdays and Thursdays, with additional classes to be added in November. There is no cost to participate. Call 330-707-2144 for information. 
Halloween party for kids at Parto’s 
YOUNGSTOWN 
Parto’s Golf, 2231 Coitsville-Hubbard Road, will have a Halloween party for children Saturday from noon to 2 p.m. Admission is $5 per person. The party will include face painting, an obstacle course, games, cupcakes, drinks, miniature golf and pumpkin decorating. Call 330-743-6718 or go to partosbigongolf.com. Other stories of interest
